student_data.notes: Undergraduate count is exact from the CSE Department's ABET accreditation disclosure (Fall 2023) for the BS in Computer Science program (excludes the 287 Software Engineering majors). Graduate counts are estimated based on Mississippi State's typical college-level ratios and IPEDS degree completion data (approx 20 MS and 10-12 PhD degrees awarded annually in CS, multiplied by program duration factors of 2.5x and 5.5x respectively). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

gpu_resources.notes: 1) Hercules Cluster: 30 compute nodes x 4 NVIDIA A100 80GB = 120 A100s (HPC site clarifies 30 compute nodes vs 32 total nodes mentioned in press release). 2) DGX-2 Systems: 2 systems x 16 V100 = 32 V100 GPUs. 3) Orion Cluster: Primary HPC system (Top500 ranked) is CPU-based (Xeon Phi/Skylake) with no significant GPU partition listed in public specs. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: MSU (HPC2) has significant compute resources (Orion is a large CPU cluster), but GPU resources are concentrated in the newer 'Hercules' system (A100s) and the specific DGX-2 nodes. No H100s found in public specifications as of May 2025.
